intro: Fridericia fagoides, commonly known as the silverleaf fridericia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
